oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Association of rumination time with non-esterified fatty acid, β-hydroxybutyrate, and serum calcium concentrations in transition dairy cows
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Paudyal, S.
Maunsell, F.
Smith, J.
Donovan, G. A.
DeVries, A.
Pinedo, P.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: dairy cattle
rumination
fatty acids
β-hydroxybutyrate
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Monitoring of health status is crucial during the transition period of dairy cows. Rumination behavior has been suggested as a parameter for assessing cow health. The objective of the current study was to explore the association between changes in rumination and blood concentrations of non-esterified fatty acids (NEFA), β-hydroxybutyrate (BHBA), and calcium (CA) in transition dairy cows.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; 2015; 210-211
